SENT.plain: Sensory deficits on the contralateral face in Wallenberg's lateral medullary syndrome (WS) may be due to an involvement of the crossing contralateral trigeminothalamic tract
Alternatively, neurons within the medullary dorsal horn (MDH) get input from the contralateral face
MDH neurons supplying the supraorbital nerve area in rat were recorded by electrophysiological techniques
In this first study on contralateral projections, about 60% of the neurons received excitatory afferent input from the contralateral face as well as the ipsilateral supraorbital area
Thus, contralateral sensory deficits in WS may be due to an involvement of these neurons
